Detailed Description

template<class ObjectType, class DataType = char>
class stBasicLEditMetricEvaluator< ObjectType, DataType >

This class implements a generic metric evaluator that calculates the distance between objects using an Lx distance function. The value of p may be any number greater than 0. In other words, this class implements L1, L2, L3, ..., Lp distance function.

The template parameter ObjectType defines the object type used by this metric evaluator. It was designed to work with instances of stBasicArray objects but any array object that defines the following methods may be used:

  • type * Get(n): Returns the element at position n.
  • int * GetSize(): Returns the number of element int hte array.

Note that to be fully compatible with the metric trees, the desired object must meet the requirements of the stObject interface also.

The template parameter P is the order of L. For example, it it is set to 3, it will implement the L3 distance function. If you set it to 2, it will implements the L2 or the Euclidean distance function.

Important Note: For L1 or L2 it is possible to use this class template with the P set as 1 or 2 but it is better to use stBasicManhatanMetricEvaluator or stBasicEuclideanMetricEvaluator instead because they have better implementations.

Author
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino.nosp@m.@icm.nosp@m.c.usp.nosp@m..br)
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvie.nosp@m.ira@.nosp@m.icmc..nosp@m.usp..nosp@m.br)
Warning
Both objects must have the same number of entries.

This class implements a generic metric evaluator that calculates the distance between objects using an Lx distance function. The value of p may be any number greater than 0. In other words, this class implements L1, L2, L3, ..., Lp distance function.

The template parameter ObjectType defines the object type used by this metric evaluator. It was designed to work with instances of stBasicArray objects but any array object that defines the following methods may be used:

  • type * Get(n): Returns the element at position n.
  • int * GetSize(): Returns the number of element int hte array.

Note that to be fully compatible with the metric trees, the desired object must meet the requirements of the stObject interface also.

The template parameter P is the order of L. For example, it it is set to 3, it will implement the L3 distance function. If you set it to 2, it will implements the L2 or the Euclidean distance function.

Important Note: For L1 or L2 it is possible to use this class template with the P set as 1 or 2 but it is better to use stBasicManhatanMetricEvaluator or stBasicEuclideanMetricEvaluator instead because they have better implementations.

d = GetDistance(o1, o2);

return d * d; }//end GetDistance2 };//end stBasicLp2MetricEvaluator This class implements a generic metric evaluator that calculates the distance between strings using the LEdit distance function.

The template parameter ObjectType defines the object type used by this metric evaluator. It was designed to work with instances of stBasicArray objects but any array object that defines the following methods may be used:

  • type * Get(n): Returns the element at position n.
  • int * GetSize(): Returns the number of element int hte array.

Note that to be fully compatible with the metric trees, the desired object must meet the requirements of the stObject interface also.

The template parameter DataType defines the type of each character. By default, it is set to char.

This implementation was based on the article "Levenshtein Distance, in Three Flavors" written by Michael Gilleland.

Author
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino.nosp@m.@icm.nosp@m.c.usp.nosp@m..br)
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvie.nosp@m.ira@.nosp@m.icmc..nosp@m.usp..nosp@m.br)
